title: A question abt something.... what was it?
content:
oh, about the archives. are some of the ID archives missing? I had someone ID a font for me as Bradley about November-ish and i can't seem to find it when i do a search (someone had posted an image i wanted to reference). I looked for the corresponding date in the archive section and it seems a whole chunk of months from Dec 2003 to Jun 2004 are missing.   
   
or have i just lost my marbles? that's a perfectly plausible situation. at any rate if anyone could point me to where to find the missing archives or reassure me that i haven't lost it completely i would appreciate it. thnx!
author: pablohoney77

comments.content: The search function has sometimes trouble digging up archived threads. But you can get there using Google's advanced search, and requesting it to return results from typophile's domain only.

thanks Yves. it's good to know that i haven't totally lost my mind yet.   
thank you, Jesus, for the tip.   
and thanks james for finding my thread for me!   
you guys rock!

Thanks, Paul, but I'm pretty sure the tip originally came from James, when questioned about his seemingly magic "search super-power" ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127231340im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

BTW, if anyone is looking for the Bradley font, it's on Dover's [24 Gothic Display Fonts CD-ROM and Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127231340/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486999556/qid=1093649658/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/103-4234994-7125408?v=glance&s=books), rather than the [Celtic and Medieval one](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127231340/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486999602/qid=1076285090/ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i1_xgl14/103-1448097-5990211?v=glance&s=books&n=507846). [Luc's page](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127231340/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/fraktur.html) has the two mixed up.
